g.text: Find a formula for the described function and state its
A rectangle has perimeter 20 m. Express the area of the
rectangle as a function of the length of one of its sides.
. Express the perimeter of the rect-
angle as a function of the length of one of its sides.
Express the area of an equilateral triangle as a function of the
A closed rectangular box with volume 8 ft
width. Express the height of the box as a function of the width.
An open rectangular box with volume 2 m
Express the surface area of the box as a function of the length
of a side of the base.
A Norman window has the shape of a rectangle surmounted
by a semicircle. ±f the perimeter of the window is 30 ft,
of the window as a function of the width
A box with an open top is to be constructed from a rectan-
gular piece of cardboard with dimensions 12 in. by 20 in.
by cutting out equal squares of side
then folding up the sides as in the Igure. Express the vol-
of the box as a function of
A cell phone plan has a basic charge of $35 a month. The
plan includes 400 free minutes and charges 10 cents for each
additional minute of usage. Write the monthly cost
±n a certain state the maximum speed permitted on freeways
h and the minimum speed is 40 mi
violating these limits is $15 for every mile per hour above the
maximum speed or below the minimum speed. Express the
as a function of the driving speed
An electricity company charges its customers a base rate
of $10 a month, plus 6 cents per kilowatt-hour (kWh) for
the Irst 1200 kWh and 7 cents per kWh for all usage over
of electricity used. Then graph the function
±n a certain country, income tax is assessed as follows. There
is no tax on income up to $10,000. Any income over $10,000
is taxed at a rate of 10%, up to an income of $20,000. Any
Sketch the graph of the tax rate
How much tax is assessed on an income of $14,000?
Sketch the graph of the total assessed tax
The functions in Example 10 and Exercise 67 are called
because their graphs look like stairs. Give two other
examples of step functions that arise in everyday life.
are shown. Decide whether each func-
tion is even, odd, or neither. Explain your reasoning.
is on the graph of an even function,
what other point must also be on the graph?
is on the graph of an odd function, what
other point must also be on the graph?
and a portion of its graph
